We are currently looking for an experienced Marketing Analyst, Asia, to join the team on a fixed-term 12-month contract.

Supporting the Asia Marketing Team, the Marketing Analyst, Asia would be responsible for gathering market insights, competitive intelligence and analysis to support the creation and implementation of category strategies across Asia.

Working closely with Regional Brand Managers and local country Marketing and Sales teams, the role is to build strong market knowledge and would be responsible for providing market data, intelligence and reports covering but not limited to, Euromonitor/Nielsen data analysis, local market scanning and mapping, competitor data gathering and price & promotions surveys.\xa0\xa0

Internally, the Marketing Analyst will lead the analysis of the effectiveness of key marketing activities, brand activation/budget tracking, consolidation of country reports and will be in-charge of Marketing operational processes.

This role will be based at our office located on St Kilda Road, Melbourne.


Desired Skills and Experience

We are looking for someone who has:

  • Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or Business Administration
  • At least 2 year(s) of working experience in the related field is required for this position; Experience in handling Asian market is a must

BIC is an equal opportunity employer and committed to recruiting, developing and maintaining a diverse workforce in compliance with all applicable Human Rights legislation. The Company will endeavor to make reasonable accommodations up to the point of undue hardship, for disabilities made known to it by its employees and applicants.

Change Leadership Consultant

Company Name AGL Energy Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 3 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Group Operations (GO) as a core division of AGL, intends to transition from an achievement focus culture to a collaborative and co-creative culture with shared learning to solve its complex challenges.




As a Change Leadership Consultant, you will play a critical role in driving cultural evolution across GO engaging with a broad set of blue and white-collar stakeholders at all levels. Key to your success will be your strengths in building trust and how you connect with their teams and then lead them.




The role will deploy interventions to unlock our people's potential and to help build awareness for change, determine how change recipients need to be and where they are now. To do this, you will be tactical in support of several strategic priorities and initiatives with the cultural evolution.


This is a 12-24 months Fixed Term Position in both Melbourne and Sydney.



Your key responsibilities will be to:

  • Develop understanding of expected cultural changes and promote new behaviours
  • Measure and track results relating to people change
  • Co-ordinate the implementation of People Change Leadership initiatives
  • Work closely with the various stakeholder groups to ensure business change is delivered effectively
  • Support the delivery of change stories
  • Identify opportunities
  • Identify business impacts, work with various stakeholder groups to acknowledge and navigate those impacts
  • Promote the GO Strategic Initiatives and execute on program strategies by working closely with stakeholder groups to understand needs and issues



To be successful, you'll have:

  • Significant Change delivery within a corporate and operational environment
  • Experience and exposure to industrialised "blue collar" environments
  • Sound understanding of people change leadership
  • Ability to engage and build trust with people and leaders at all levels
  • Decision making authority within project scope
  • Achievement oriented - willingness, energy and drive to go beyond
  • Budget accountability & decision-making authority



What's in it for you?
 You'll be working in an A-grade building with state of the art activity based working facilities. Being supported by our new flexible ways of working. We call it Smarter Working.

You'll get the opportunity to work with some of the most engaged and innovative in the business. Being exposed to more opportunities to advance your skills and career.

Working in a company the size of ours the sky's the limit for your career aspirations and we're focused on investing in you.


About us
 It truly is an exciting time to be part of AGL Energy as we lead the way in generating sustainable energy solutions for all Australians.

With a heritage of over 175 years and listed in the top 50 companies on the ASX, AGL offers a genuinely diverse, safe and supportive work environment, where "actions not words" fosters a culture of achievement and personal development.





Come with us on a journey of exploration and creativity, doing the same things differently, better, faster by encompassing innovation and passion for a more sustainable world.

Contract

919289792:
[

Data and Analytics Manager

Company Name REA Group Company Location Sydney, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 2 hours ago Number of views 7 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


We're reimagining the way we use data in REA, Hometrack Australia have recently joined the REA family to help us on this journey and we'd love you to come help us too.



About the role
The Data and Analytics Manager sits within the Hometrack Team headed up by Brendan Darcy. The Hometrack team work together to provide property data services to the financial sector. It's suite of products includes property data analytics and insights, customised data platforms and an Automated Valuation Model (AVM). Hometrack is a core part of the REA strategy and will allow us to deliver more property data and insights to our customers and consumers.



This role will manage, support and develop the Australian Quantitative Team at Hometrack. You will also form part of the Hometrack Leadership Group.

The Data and Analytics Manager will collaborate with the Hometrack CEO, Hometrack CTO, Application Development, and Commercial teams on priorities, planning and business strategy, whilst also providing direct customer technical support as required by the Commercial Team.



What you will be doing:
The role will support the Hometrack Team in the following ways:

  • Quantitative modelling of property and mortgage data
  • Analysis and design of core complex functionality
  • Advancement of existing product performance (algorithms)
  • Analytical research and development
  • Analytical support across Hometrack product suite
  • Implementation of core complex functionality
  • Provision of data platform(s) supporting analysis and design
  • Development (programming prototypes to beta phase)




What we expect:

  • Excellent communication skills, written and verbal
  • High-calibre degree in Statistics, Mathematics or another quantitative discipline, an advanced degree is preferred
  • A proven track record in successfully building high performance teams of similar size
  • Knowledge of probability theory, statistics and algebra
  • Understanding of common modelling techniques such as sampling, logistic regression, linear regression, decisions trees, neural networks and time series analysis
  • Experience of working in a data-rich environment with data mining techniques and predictive analytics
  • R, Matlab and T-SQL
  • Ability to cleanse and analyse large sets of data, identify trends, and develop and validate quantitative models




Highly regarded skills:

  • Proven track record of success in small- to mid-size organisations
  • Exposure to scorecard development an advantage
  • Exposure to property and mortgage data
  • Experience in, directly or indirectly, mortgage credit risk management processes
  • Deep experience in spatial temporal modelling techniques
  • Advanced database programming skills




What is it like to work with us in Hometrack?
Each team in Hometrack has around 8-10 people who work together across technology, product and delivery as an autonomous unit. We believe strongly in testing and continuous delivery, mixed with large doses of fun. We support funded training and personal development



Each week we participate in guilds across the company to keep our skills sharp and increase our impact, and in team retrospectives where we keep track of how our team is going. Your manager acts as a mentor to help guide you and your career, instead of being someone who monitors your day to day.



We're committed to creating inclusive, safe environments where anyone, no matter their background, can contribute and succeed.



What you get beyond a great remuneration package?

  • Birthday leave. A day off for your birthday.
  • Flexible working arrangements. We've got people who work part time, and people who work from home one day a week.
  • 3 days every 4 months in our regular hackathon - See: http://hackday.realestate.com.au
  • Industry-leading parental leave system.
  • Free breakfast (and who doesn't love a free brekkie)




About REA Group
REA Group is one of the world's largest property and lifestyle media companies. Best known in Australia for realestate.com.au, the market-leading property site and app, we're also a fast-growing global business spanning three regions. People use our sites and apps when finding a place to rent or buy (a home, co-work space or commercial property), as well as for property data, news, financial services, inspiration, renovation ideas, and to better understand their neighbourhoods and the property market. From our humble beginnings in a Melbourne garage more than 20 years ago, to a global company helping reimagine digital property experiences; we have played a key role in shaping the entire digital sector in Australia, especially through the talented people we have nurtured, and continue to develop.

Previous sales experience is advantageous. \xa0We are looking for a 'people person' who has an eye for detail and who will thrive in a high pressure, fast paced working environment. \xa0


Sales Role in Eastern Melbourne
Higher Commissions than industry Award
Work amongst a young energetic team


What you would be doing


The main things that you would be doing include:


  • Establish, develop and maintain positive customer relationships
  • Analyse existing/potential customer needs
  • Present, promote and sell products/services to existing and prospective customers
  • Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule
  • Track sales and provide status reports
  • Ensure the swift resolution of customer problems and complaints
  • Keep abreast of best practices in market and communicate trends back to the business
  • Preparing Sales listing kits
  • Liaising with Vendors and Buyers
  • Attending Open For Inspections

  • Buyer call backs and some prospecting

  • Assisting at property appraisals

  • Handling exchanges and settlements

  • Property marketing and advertising

  • Assisting at property auctions

  • General administration duties\xa0 \xa0 \xa0 \xa0\xa0


Who we’re looking for


We’re looking for candidates with the following skills and experience:


  • Excellent knowledge of MS Office
  • Knowledge of Box & Dice is preferred
  • Proven ability to build positive professional relationships with clients
  • Highly motivated and target driven with a proven track record in sales
  • Excellent selling, communication and negotiation skills
  • Proven willingness to learn and improve
  • Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience needs
  • Agents Representative Certificate or Licensed \xa0Estate Agent Certificate
  • Australian Drivers License is a must with a reliable Car.


Why apply?


Reasons why we think this is a great role include:


  • Competitive Commission Structure
  • Opportunities for growth and career progression
  • Join a dynamic and supportive team
  • On going training \xa0


Please Email your Cover Letter and Resume to our Office Manager Mia - mloupos@bigginscott.com.au or for a confidential chat please call 98820033

The SAP Solution Architect role is designed to provide key services within Oxygen. These include Direction Setting and Advice with respect to Solutions, Capability Development, Sales Support, Product Development and Architectural Consulting Services.

This is a permanent role based in Melbourne.

The Solution Architect role encompasses the following :
\xa0
Solution\xa0Direction Setting
  • Facilitate the alignment of product development, capability development, sales effort and marketing direction

About Us

The Transport Accident Commission (TAC) is a Victorian Government-owned organisation. The role of the TAC is to promote road safety through the Towards Zero road deaths and serious injuries strategy, improve the State's trauma system and support those who have been injured on our roads.

TAC Benefits

We offer a range of exciting benefits, including:

  • Health and wellbeing services, including onsite doctor, flu vaccinations, fresh fruit and subsidised gym memberships

Technical Lead - global trading product

Company Name IRESS Company Location Level 16 385 Bourke Street Melbourne, Melbourne, VIC 3000, AU

New Posted Date Posted 8 hours ago Number of views 22 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About IRESS


IRESS is a principal global supplier of share market and wealth management systems producing innovative, sophisticated solutions. We provide solutions that help hundreds of thousands of people with life's big decisions – from getting a mortgage approval, planning for retirement, to trading on the stock exchange – things that make a real difference to people's lives and financial well-being. We began in 1993 as a small Australian tech start-up. Now we're a global team of over 1,750 brilliantly-minded people across five continents – and we're still growing. We're listed on the Australian Stock Exchange, with a strong financial track record and our continuous investment in product development and innovation is what keeps us ahead of the game.


About the role


As a Technical Lead you’ll join a team to solve our most complex problems across performance, reliability and usability goals. Specifically tackling work across the live trading and portfolio management domains.


\xa0You’ll solve problems at incredible complexity as our financial markets products process over 10K transactions per second with 2 million+ users globally. This is a hands-on role that focuses on building and enhancing our engineering capabilities, improving technical practices and helping shape the future of our approaches, platforms and frameworks.


Duties include: -


  • Support multiple technology teams through advice, coaching, leadership and enablement
  • Identify opportunities delivering the company’s engineering capabilities, including identification of opportunities for innovation
  • Play a key role in migrating our products to the web, working with a variety of languages and libraries including Python, Javascript, React, Typescript, C++ etc.
  • Tools include JIRA, Bitbucket, SonarQube, Artifactory etc
  • Contribute to a huge initiative to move to AWS as we introduce DevOps practices
  • Identify technology trends and evolving consumer behaviours
  • Collaborate with other teams to evaluate and identify appropriate technology platforms for our products.
  • Contribute to the implementation of our Continuous Delivery pipeline using TeamCity
  • Take a leadership role in the development of an enterprise-wide information security plan
  • Review current development frameworks and help establish initial architecture for new products
  • Work closely with Technical Leads in other areas to solve new, complex problems across a range of products
  • Maintain up-to-date knowledge of technology standards, industry trends, emerging technologies
  • Help ensure that technology standards and approaches are consistent and maintained
  • Communicate the technology strategy to other teams within IRESS
  • Finding better ways of doing things


With a new CTO who joined us last year, we have a strong vision to continually improve the way we build products. You’ll have the license to drive change and play a key part in our goal to become the most desired technology company within financial services.\xa0


About You

  • Experience in a similar role as a Senior Software Engineer, Senior Developer, Team Lead, Software Architect etc
  • Strong knowledge of web technology, any combination of Python, Java, Ruby, Javascript, React, Typescript etc
  • Expert knowledge of technical architecture, software engineering and infrastructure
  • Strong verbal and written communications skills and able to translate complex technical subjects for a diverse audience and all levels of management
  • Proven ability to navigate ambiguity and collaborate with other functional leaders to provide positive outcomes
  • Technical aptitude to probe, assess and understand their technology environment


Culture


We recognize and reward hard work and celebrate our successes over a Friday afternoon drink and at various socials throughout the year. We don't sweat the small stuff either, our dress code is as relaxed as we are. As well as local charity events and initiatives, we hold global days and activities to make the most of our global strength and diversity. This includes a yearly global hackathon! We may be one of the largest financial software providers, but we haven't forgotten our roots; we've kept the entrepreneurial spirit and agility that defined our early years - it's something we continue to look for and admire in our people.


Benefits


  • Subsidized health insurance
  • 3 days leave per year to participate in charity initiatives
  • Access to various learning and development programs.
  • Up to 26 weeks paid parental leave for primary carers (up to 4 weeks for secondary carers) and the ability to work part-time when returning to work.


Want to have a significant impact in one of Australia’s fastest growing technology companies? If so please apply – we look forward to hearing from you.


We are an equal opportunity employer and embrace diversity at IRESS. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status or disability status.

At PwC, we help Australian businesses, not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. Be sure to follow Leica Biosystems on LinkedIn!

Leica Biosystems is a global leader in workflow solutions and automation. As the only company to own the workflow from biopsy to diagnosis, we are uniquely positioned to break down the barriers between each of these steps. Our mission of “Advancing Cancer Diagnostics, Improving Lives” is at the heart of our corporate culture. Our easy-to-use and consistently reliable offerings help improve workflow efficiency and diagnostic confidence. The company is represented in over 100 countries. It has manufacturing facilities in 9 countries, sales and service organizations in 19 countries, and an international network of dealers. The company is headquartered in Nussloch, Germany. Visit LeicaBiosystems.com for more information.
Danaher is a global science & technology innovator committed to helping our customers solve complex challenges and improve quality of life worldwide. Our world class brands are leaders in some of the most demanding and attractive industries, including life sciences, medical diagnostics, dental, environmental and applied solutions. Our globally diverse team of 67,000 associates is united by a common culture and operating system, the Danaher Business System, which serves as our competitive advantage. We generated $18.3B in revenue last year. We are ranked #162 on the Fortune 500 and our stock has outperformed the S&P 500 by more than 1,200% over 20 years.

At Danaher, you can build a career in a way no other company can duplicate. Our brands allow us to offer dynamic careers across multiple industries. We’re innovative, fast-paced, results-oriented, and we win. We need talented people to keep winning. Here you’ll learn how DBS is used to shape strategy, focus execution, align our people, and create value for customers and shareholders. Come join our winning team.

Multiple roles - Sydney, Melbourne or Canberra based.\xa0\xa0

The role takes responsibility for the architecture and design of technology components that form the solutions. These solutions typically involve a combination of data engineering, analytics, automated decisioning, integration and digital channel technology components. You will have the responsibility from solution conception through to successful implementation.

This role will not only focus on client engagements but will also contribute to the definition and enhancement of technical architecture disciplines within the practice.

919250338:
[

Corporate Accountant

Company Name Wilmar Sugar Australia Limited Company Location 265 Whitehall Street Yarraville, Melbourne, VIC 3013, AU

New Posted Date Posted 5 hours ago Number of views 18 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About the Company


Wilmar International Limited, founded in 1991 and headquartered in Singapore, is today Asia's leading agribusiness group. Wilmar's business activities include oil palm cultivation, oilseeds crushing edible oils refining, sugar milling and refining, specialty fats, oleo chemicals, biodiesel and fertiliser manufacturing and grains processing. We have over 450 manufacturing plants in 13 countries and an extensive distribution network covering China, India, Indonesia and some 50 other countries, backed by a multinational workforce of about 90,000 people.


Wilmar is the leader in sugar and renewable energy. Our sugar operations follow a natural and sustainable cycle - creating renewable energy and fuel from sugarcane by-products, and producing fertilizers which are applied to cane fields.


We are experts in raw sugar production, market champions in sweeteners, and progressive thought leaders in the energetic pursuit of sugar as a renewable and sustainable resource.


Job Vacancy


An opportunity exists within our Group Finance team for an experienced Corporate Accountant to join on a full time basis. This role will report directly into the Group Finance Manager and is based in our Yarraville office.


The qualified accountant will be part of the dynamic Group Finance team that resides within Wilmar Sugar Australia's corporate office. The role includes responsibility for Group consolidations, preparation of corporate office results, preparation of monthly management and financial reporting, and the annual statutory reporting in accordance with IFRS and Australian Accounting Standards governance and internal controls.


Period-end closing tasks include: reconciliations, journal entries, variance analysis, management reporting, consolidated reporting to Singapore parent, maintenance of SAP FICO aspects and period end timetables, as well as systems to support accurate capture of financial information.


The role is a key business partner to Business Unit (BU) finance teams and the Singapore-based financial reporting team, providing support on accounting technical matters and financial analysis by utilising systems information, whilst maintaining best practice accounting policies and procedures across the Group.


The Successful Applicant

  • Professional qualification (CA/CPA)
  • 4-5 years' experience in commerce with a background from Big 4 environment
  • Sound understanding of accounting principles, standards and commercial application thereof
  • Advanced Microsoft Office skills - especially Excel
  • Familiarity with SAP and BW reporting preferred.
  • Exposure to internal controls and business governance requirements
  • Ability to map and document problems and processes and propose solutions


The ideal candidate will be a self-starter with previous relevant experience. You will have excellent communication and interpersonal skills, and will have a strong attention to detail. We are looking for someone with a positive disposition, who thinks creatively, works efficiently and enjoys finding solutions on their own accord.


In return for your skills and capabilities, Wilmar Sugar offers a competitive remuneration package, challenging and stimulating work, and a great team environment with opportunities for career and personal growth and development.


How to apply


Confidential applications should be submitted online by hitting the "Apply now!" button below. If you have any questions or require further information, please contact Rose Climaco on 9283 4594.

919213544:
[

Compliance/Investigations Officer

Company Name VicRoads Company Location Burwood, AU

New Posted Date Posted 7 hours ago Number of views 15 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Victoria has embarked on a transformation of Victoria’s roads to sustain growth in our population and economy to meet the aspirations of Victorians for an integrated transport system.

About The Business Area

The Compliance Operations Team sits within the broader Heavy Vehicle Services business area and supports Transport for Victoria. VicRoads is the Regulator that is responsible for ensuring that drivers and operators of heavy vehicles comply with the requirements of the law. In addition to enforcing penalties in response to past non-compliance, VicRoads is also committed to engaging with drivers and operators to improve future compliance.

VicRoads is reinforcing its commitment to improve future compliance.

About The Role

We currently have two opportunities available for Compliance Officers to join our dynamic and dedicated team. As the Compliance Officer, you will participate in compliance and education activities to ensure all stakeholders meet their obligations. You will also contribute to the preparation of prevention and deterrent strategies, to minimise operator non-conformance. Due to the sensitivities of the role, the successful candidates must demonstrate integrity of the highest order, autonomy and objectivity.

Some Of The Key Duties Of This Role Include
  • preparation of best practice policies
  • liaising with internal and external stakeholders including heavy vehicle operators to prevent non-compliance with regulations

About The Successful Candidate

The successful incumbent has excellent written and verbal communication skills and a proactive approach. You will utilise these skills to influence heavy vehicle drivers and operators to improve compliance. You are well organised with solid time management skills with an ability to work to strict reporting deadlines. You have strong analysis and problem solving skills and you present professionally and conduct yourself ethically. You will be able to exercise sound independent judgment to identify trends.

What We Offer

To attract, retain and develop talented people, we provide genuine flexibility, a culture that supports people to be their best and on top of that - great opportunities for career development. We embrace diversity and inclusion and are proud our workforce reflects the community we serve.

If you are interested in this role, please attach your CV and a cover letter addressing the key capabilities to your application.

Should you be successful in progressing to the next stage, an assessment centre will be held in November.

Recruitment agencies – please note VicRoads does not accept resumes from third parties and will not be responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

VicRoads is required to evidence your right to work in Australia and may ask for your consent to check records maintained by the Department of Immigration and Border Protection as well as records maintained by Victoria Police and VicRoads as part of the selection process. Information provided to VicRoads will be treated in the strictest confidence.

For more information or a confidential discussion, please contact Peter Ervin on 03 9881 8775.

Key Accountabilities
KA 1.


Negotiate and influence companies operating heavy vehicles to prevent non compliance with all regulatory requirements under broad supervision.

KA 2.


Provide advice to companies operating heavy vehicles that may impact on the decisions they make.

KA 3.


Use conceptual and analytical skills to co-ordinate data relating to the non compliance of drivers to educate companies operating heavy vehicles.

KA 4.


Develop responses to moderately complex compliance problems.

KA 5.


Contribute to the development and improvement of policies and strategies to deter companies operating heavy vehicles from non compliance with all regulatory requirements.

KA 6.


Use negotiation and influencing skills in cooperating with companies operating heavy vehicles and develop solutions to reach successful outcomes

Key Capabilities

KC 1.


Demonstrated ability to negotiate and influence companies to prevent non compliance with regulations under broad supervision.

KC 2.


Demonstrated ability to provide advice that stakeholders act on in relation to policies and procedures.

KC 3.


Demonstrated ability to exercise independent judgement to identify trends and provide sound advice to companies.

KC 4.

Demonstrated ability to develop innovative responses to moderately complex compliance problems.

KC 5.


Demonstrated ability to prepare ‘best practice’ policies and practices for consideration by key stakeholders.

KC 6.


Demonstrated ability to build and maintain relationships with companies to achieve successful outcomes.

Prerequisites
PR 1.


An appropriate tertiary qualification is an advantage.

PR 2.


Extensive experience in the prevention of non compliance.
